meanings.definition: A narrow passageway between or behind buildings.
meanings.sent1: The cat darted down the alley to escape the dog.
meanings.sent2: I walked through the alley to get to the main street.
meanings.sent3: The alley was so narrow that only one person could pass through at a time.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness of the alley, shadows danced like ghosts.
meanings.sent5: The smell of garbage in the alley made my nose wrinkle.

meanings.sent1: She bowled a strike down the alley.
meanings.sent2: The bowler aimed carefully at the alley.
meanings.sent3: The alley echoed with the sound of crashing pins.
meanings.sent4: The alley was slick with oil for smooth ball rolling.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the alley made the pins sparkle.

meanings.sent1: The alley was a peaceful place for a leisurely stroll.
meanings.sent2: The trees in the alley provided shade on hot days.
meanings.sent3: Squirrels played in the trees along the alley.
meanings.sent4: The alley looked like a tunnel of green leaves.
meanings.sent5: Birds chirped happily in the alley, creating a symphony of nature.
